Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a tool for censorship and oppression.
Politicians and mainstream media are identified as primary sources of misinformation and disinformation.
The bill is perceived as unequal and potentially fascist if not applied equally to all media and public statements by politicians.
The bill is viewed as a threat to free speech and a sign of governmental weakness.
The terms 'misinformation' and 'disinformation' are considered vague and open to arbitrary application.
The bill could lead to a chilling effect on free speech and self-censorship.
Notable Quotes: The proposed Bill is an instrument for censorship and oppression, nothing less.
A government of strength does not fear the free speech of the people.
Censorship is a manifestation of the ideologies of Fascism and Totalitarianism.
